1.description: The anxious black NightWing scholar who struggles with his loyalty to his birth tribe versus his loyalty to his friends. Haunted by the knowledge that his tribe has been deceiving everyone.

15.description: Learns that his father Mastermind has been conducting horrific experiments on RainWings, forcing him to confront the evil within his own family.

relationships.Glory: Queen whose people his father tortured

25.description: Loses his sight permanently while saving his friends from a volcanic explosion, but gains inner strength and clarity about what truly matters.

relationships.Fatespeaker: Dragon who becomes his eyes and partner
relationships.Clay: Friend who helps him adapt to blindness

1.description: The loyal brown MudWing who provides steady support to Starflight as he struggles with difficult truths about his tribe and family.

relationships.Starflight: Fellow dragonet he cares for deeply

1.description: The fierce SeaWing princess who stands by Starflight during his crisis of loyalty, even as she struggles with her own complex feelings about family and duty.
The newly crowned queen of both RainWings and NightWings who must navigate the complex politics of ruling two very different tribes while maintaining her friendships.
The optimistic small SandWing who provides emotional support to all her friends, especially Starflight as he faces the terrible truths about his tribe.

2.description: A cheerful black NightWing dragonet who was raised as an alternative to Starflight. Unlike most NightWings, she's optimistic and kind-hearted.

relationships.Starflight: Dragon she was meant to replace but comes to love

20.description: Reveals her true feelings for Starflight and her desire to help him rather than replace him in the prophecy.

relationships.Starflight: Dragon she loves and wants to help

3.description: The imposing NightWing elder whose lies about the prophecy are finally being exposed. Desperate to maintain control as his schemes unravel.

10.description: A cold NightWing scientist conducting horrific experiments on captured RainWings. Shows no remorse for his cruel research.

15.description: Revealed to be Starflight's biological father, creating a devastating personal conflict for Starflight between family loyalty and moral righteousness.

relationships.Battlewinner: Queen he serves with his research

16.description: The true NightWing queen who has been trapped in ice for years after fighting an IceWing. Rules through fear and desperation from her icy prison.

relationships.Greatness: Daughter who rules in her name
relationships.Morrowseer: Elder who carries out her will
relationships.Glory: RainWing queen she wants to overthrow

16.description: Battlewinner's anxious daughter who acts as queen while her mother is trapped in ice. Constantly worried about making the wrong decisions.

8.description: A NightWing who actually possesses the rare power of reading minds, making her valuable but also burdened by constantly hearing others' thoughts.

relationships.Battlewinner: Queen whose thoughts she must read
relationships.Glory: RainWing queen she learns to respect

16.description: A powerful NightWing elder who serves on the tribal council and supports the invasion of RainWing territory.

4.description: An aggressive orange SkyWing dragonet who was part of the alternative set of prophecy dragonets. Hostile toward the original dragonets and ambitious for power.
A quiet brown MudWing dragonet from the alternative set. Less aggressive than Fierceteeth but equally resentful of being considered second-best.

relationships.Clay: Original dragonet he was meant to replace

4.description: A small yellow SandWing dragonet with a deadly venomous tail, part of the alternative prophecy group. More ruthless than Sunny despite their similar size.

relationships.Sunny: Original dragonet she was meant to replace

6.description: A red SkyWing dragonet from the alternative group who has been horribly scarred by experiments, making him bitter and angry toward everyone.

4.description: A blue SeaWing dragonet from the backup group who is cowardly and easily frightened, very different from the brave Tsunami he was meant to replace.

relationships.Tsunami: Dragonet he was meant to replace

8.description: A ruthless NightWing assassin who remains loyal to the tribe's leadership, unlike Deathbringer who defected to Glory's side.

12.description: A NightWing warrior who follows orders without question and supports the tribe's plan to invade RainWing territory.

14.description: A NightWing mother struggling to raise her dragonets in the harsh conditions of the volcanic island, worried about their future.

relationships.Glory: Queen offering hope for her family
relationships.Battlewinner: Queen whose policies endanger her dragonets

10.description: A NightWing scholar who works with Mastermind on the cruel experiments, representing the intellectual corruption of the tribe.

relationships.Glory: Queen whose subjects they experimented on

2.description: The former NightWing assassin who now serves as Glory's devoted protector, having abandoned his loyalty to the NightWing leadership.

relationships.Vengeance: Former partner who still serves the tribe

2.description: Glory's half-brother and trusted advisor who helps her navigate the complexities of ruling two very different tribes.

relationships.Deathbringer: NightWing he learns to work with

2.description: The energetic young RainWing who continues to support Glory's reign and helps bridge the gap between RainWings and NightWings.
The RainWing who was finally reunited with his partner Orchid after she was rescued from NightWing experimentation.

relationships.Orchid: Partner he never stopped searching for

2.description: The RainWing who survived horrific experiments at the hands of NightWing scientists and is slowly recovering with her family.

relationships.Mangrove: Partner who never gave up on her

12.description: A NightWing warrior serving under Queen Battlewinner's regime, participating in the tribe's military operations.

16.description: A NightWing guard stationed on the volcanic island who patrols the perimeter and maintains security around the NightWing settlement.

12.description: A NightWing guard who patrols the volcanic island, watching for intruders and maintaining order among the desperate population.

16.description: A NightWing guardian responsible for protecting the tribe's most important locations and prisoners on the volcanic island.
A NightWing elder who serves on the tribal council, helping make decisions about the tribe's desperate situation and invasion plans.
A NightWing council member who helps plan the invasion of RainWing territory and supports the tribe's military operations.
A NightWing elder on the tribal council who participates in the desperate planning to save their dying tribe.

10.description: A NightWing who specializes in interrogating prisoners and extracting information, working closely with the scientists conducting experiments.

8.description: A NightWing scientist who studies the volcanic activity threatening their island home, trying to predict eruptions and find solutions.
A NightWing geologist who works with Volcano to study the dangerous volcanic conditions threatening their homeland.
A NightWing scientist specializing in lava flow patterns and volcanic hazards, trying to keep the tribe safe from eruptions.

12.description: A NightWing soldier serving in the tribal military, prepared to fight in the planned invasion of RainWing territory.
A NightWing warrior who serves as both ground fighter and aerial scout for the tribe's military operations.
A fierce NightWing soldier known for aggressive fighting tactics and unwavering loyalty to the tribal military command.

10.description: A NightWing who claims to have prophetic abilities and helps interpret omens and signs for the tribal leadership.
A NightWing who works with other seers to interpret visions and prophecies, though most lack any real prophetic power.
A NightWing who participates in the elaborate deception about prophetic powers, helping maintain the tribe's mystique.

12.description: A NightWing scribe responsible for keeping records and documenting the tribe's activities and experimental research.
A NightWing who maintains the tribe's historical records and documents their current desperate situation.
A NightWing archivist who organizes and preserves the tribe's knowledge and research findings.

8.description: A NightWing hunter who searches for food and resources on the barren volcanic island, struggling to feed the tribe.

relationships.Secretkeeper: Dragon he tries to help feed

8.description: A NightWing who forages for whatever food and materials can be found on the dying volcanic island.

relationships.Battlewinner: Queen whose tribe he tries to feed

8.description: A swift NightWing hunter who ranges far from the island trying to find food and supplies for the starving tribe.

10.description: A SandWing dragon captured and held prisoner by the NightWings for use in Mastermind's cruel experiments.
An IceWing warrior captured by NightWings and subjected to horrific medical experiments in the island laboratories.
A RainWing healer captured and used for experiments, representing the ongoing atrocities against Glory's tribe.

relationships.Glory: Queen working to rescue her tribe

10.description: A gentle RainWing held captive and experimented on by NightWing scientists, suffering alongside other prisoners.
A SeaWing scout captured while exploring and now held prisoner for NightWing experiments.
A SeaWing messenger captured by NightWings and held for experimentation alongside other tribal prisoners.
A strong MudWing soldier captured during border conflicts and now imprisoned by NightWings for experiments.

relationships.Clay: MudWing who might help rescue him

10.description: A MudWing guard captured and held prisoner, subjected to the same cruel experiments as other tribal captives.

3.description: A SkyWing warrior on patrol who encounters the dragonets during their journey to Jade Mountain, representing ongoing tribal tensions.

relationships.Glory: Queen whose territory he flies near

3.description: A SkyWing scout working with Cardinal to patrol the mountain territories and monitor for threats or intruders.

5.description: An IceWing scout patrolling the northern territories, monitoring for NightWing activity and other tribal movements.
An IceWing patrol member working with Avalanche to monitor tribal borders and watch for threats.

4.description: A SeaWing messenger who carries news between the ocean kingdom and other territories, encountering the dragonets.

6.description: Squid's father, a veteran SeaWing warrior who worries about his son's involvement with the alternative dragonets.
A young NightWing dragonet who grew up alongside Starflight on the island, sharing the harsh conditions and limited education.
An ambitious young NightWing dragonet who dreams of becoming a great warrior despite the tribe's desperate circumstances.

10.description: A young NightWing training to become a warrior, learning combat skills despite the tribe's limited resources.
A young NightWing learning combat techniques and warrior skills in preparation for the planned invasion.
An eager young NightWing training in combat and assassination techniques, hoping to serve the tribe like Vengeance.

6.description: A scholarly young NightWing who studies alongside Wisdom and other intellectuals, hoping to contribute to the tribe's knowledge.
A bright young NightWing dragonet who excels in studies and research, though limited by the tribe's declining resources.

2.description: A SkyWing who worked with Kestrel in the past and has knowledge of the original prophecy conspiracy.
Another SkyWing who was part of Kestrel's network of dragons involved in the prophecy deception.

3.description: A NightWing operative who carries out Morrowseer's secret missions and helps maintain the prophecy deception.
A covert NightWing agent who operates in secret for Morrowseer, gathering intelligence and eliminating threats.

5.description: A deadly NightWing enforcer who eliminates problems for Morrowseer and ensures the prophecy conspiracy stays secret.

8.description: A NightWing mother struggling to care for her dragonets on the dying volcanic island, desperate for a better future.

relationships.Battlewinner: Queen whose policies endanger her family

8.description: Another NightWing mother on the island, worried about her dragonets' safety and future under the current leadership.

relationships.Greatness: Acting queen she hopes will help

12.description: An elderly NightWing who remembers better times before the volcanic island and mourns what the tribe has become.

relationships.Starflight: Young dragon who might restore honor

12.description: One of the oldest NightWings alive, who remembers the tribe's former glory and is horrified by their current state.

10.description: A NightWing who performs menial tasks around the island, including helping with the cruel experiments.

relationships.Secretkeeper: Dragon he tries to help when possible

10.description: A NightWing forced to assist in the laboratory experiments, hating the work but having no choice.

relationships.Orchid: RainWing victim he feels guilty about

recaps.1: Starflight struggles with the knowledge that his NightWing tribe has been deceiving everyone about the prophecy and committing terrible crimes against the RainWings.
recaps.2: The dragonets encounter Fatespeaker and learn about the alternative set of dragonets that were trained as backups to the prophecy, creating tension about their true importance.
recaps.3: Morrowseer's desperation becomes apparent as his careful plans start falling apart, and he becomes more dangerous in his attempts to maintain control.
recaps.4: Starflight meets the alternative dragonets - Fierceteeth, Ochre, Viper, Flame, and Squid - who resent being considered second-best to the originals.
recaps.5: The conflict between the original and alternative dragonets intensifies as both groups are forced to work together despite their mutual distrust.
recaps.6: Starflight learns more about the horrific experiments being conducted on captured RainWings and begins to understand the full scope of his tribe's evil.
recaps.7: The political situation on the NightWing island becomes more unstable as different factions struggle for power and influence over the tribe's future.
recaps.8: Starflight encounters Mindreader, one of the few NightWings with actual powers, who reveals more about the true state of their dying homeland.
recaps.9: The conditions on the volcanic NightWing island worsen, with food shortages and dangerous eruptions threatening the entire tribe's survival.
recaps.10: Starflight discovers the laboratory where RainWings are being tortured and experimented on, witnessing firsthand the cruelty of NightWing scientists.
recaps.11: The alternative dragonets are forced to confront the reality that they may be just as expendable as the originals in the NightWing leadership's plans.
recaps.12: Tensions escalate as Glory's influence grows and the NightWing leadership realizes their control over the situation is slipping away.
recaps.13: Starflight struggles with his identity as a NightWing while witnessing the evil his tribe is capable of, questioning everything he thought he knew about himself.
recaps.14: The plight of ordinary NightWing families becomes clear as mothers like Secretkeeper worry about their dragonets' future in the deteriorating homeland.
recaps.15: Starflight makes the devastating discovery that Mastermind, the lead scientist torturing RainWings, is his own biological father.
recaps.16: Queen Battlewinner is revealed in her ice prison, showing the desperation driving the NightWing tribe's increasingly evil actions.
recaps.17: The political maneuvering intensifies as different NightWing factions position themselves for the expected takeover of RainWing territory.
recaps.18: Starflight must choose between loyalty to his blood family and tribe versus loyalty to his chosen family and moral principles.
recaps.19: The alternative dragonets begin to question their role in the prophecy and whether they're fighting for the right side in this conflict.
recaps.20: Fatespeaker reveals her true feelings and attempts to bridge the gap between the alternative and original dragonets through compassion.
recaps.21: The situation on the island becomes critical as volcanic activity increases and the NightWing leadership's plans become more desperate and dangerous.
recaps.22: Starflight witnesses more atrocities committed by his tribe and realizes he can no longer remain neutral in the conflict between NightWings and RainWings.
recaps.23: The final confrontation approaches as both sides prepare for a battle that will determine the fate of both the NightWing and RainWing tribes.
recaps.24: Starflight makes his choice to stand with Glory and his friends against his own tribe, accepting the consequences of opposing his family and heritage.
recaps.25: During the climactic volcanic eruption, Starflight sacrifices his sight to save his friends, proving his loyalty through ultimate personal sacrifice.
recaps.26: The aftermath of the eruption forces both tribes to confront the reality of their situation and the need for a new way forward.
recaps.27: Starflight begins adapting to his blindness with help from Fatespeaker, discovering that his inner strength matters more than his physical abilities.
recaps.28: The two tribes begin the difficult process of learning to coexist, with Starflight finding his place in this new world despite his changed circumstances.
